course_title: Advanced Topics in Sociological Research: Pathways after Loss
class_notes:
Topic:  Pathways after Loss: Racial Inequities in Mortality and Bereavement


The loss of an important figure at a particular time can completely alter oneÂ¿s future trajectory. This course investigates the socioeconomic and health impacts of losing a loved one and the pathways individuals are set on after loss. Elevated rates of mortality experienced by Black families and communities consequently lead to mass bereavement. These deaths not only immediately disrupt lives as individuals wade through grief and mourning but can set off a ripple of cascading consequences in the lives of the bereaved. In this course, we will examine the ripple or "spillover" effects of Black-White disparities in mortality by considering intergenerational consequences of deaths for survivors' health and socioeconomic wellbeing.
